column5: SAN FRANCISCO Activists have sued the city and county of San Francisco over a pilot program giving shuttles run by Google and other private companies access to municipal bus stops  claiming it favors higher-paid technology workers over low-income residents.

column4: Airlines exempt from September 11 environmental claim: U.S. court
column5: NEW YORK American Airlines  United Airlines and the World Trade Center leaseholder do not have to pay a property developer environmental cleanup costs from the September 11  2001 hijacked plane attacks  a U.S. appeals court ruled on Friday.

column4: Airlines exempt from Sept. 11 environmental claim -U.S. court
column5: NEW YORK  May 2 American Airlines  United Airlines and the World Trade Center leaseholder do not have to pay a property developer environmental cleanup costs from the Sept. 11  2001 hijacked plane attacks  a U.S. appeals court ruled on Friday.

column4: Jury reaches verdict in Apple-Samsung patents trial
column5: SAN JOSE  California The jury has reached a verdict on Friday in a patent trial between Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  which will be read in a San Jose  California federal courtroom shortly  according to a court official.

column4: Jury reaches verdict in Apple-Samsung patents trial
column5: SAN JOSE  Calif.  May 2 The jury has reached a verdict on Friday in a patent trial between Apple Inc  and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  which will be read in a San Jose  California federal courtroom shortly  according to a court official.

column4: Apple raises US$12bn in perfect style
column5: NEW YORK  May 2 (IFR) - Apple wielded the kind of marketing magic in the bond market that it is known for in the tech industry this week when it managed to convince US investors to buy US$12bn more of its bonds at premium prices  just a year after its US$17bn offering left hundreds of bondholders under water.

column4: Endocyte's ovarian cancer drug fails trial  shares sink
column5: Merck & Co Inc and Endocyte Inc said they had stopped a late-stage trial of their experimental ovarian cancer drug as it failed to improve survival rates without the cancer worsening  sending Endocyte's shares tumbling as much as 63 percent.

column4: Bill Gates on track to own no Microsoft stock in four years
column5: SEATTLE Bill Gates  the former chief executive and chairman of Microsoft Corp  will have no direct ownership in the company he co-founded by mid-2018 if he keeps up his recent share sales.

column4: Bill Gates on track to own no Microsoft stock in four years
column5: SEATTLE  May 2 Bill Gates  the former chief executive and chairman of Microsoft Corp  will have no direct ownership in the company he co-founded by mid-2018 if he keeps up his recent share sales.

column5: LOS ANGELES/SAN FRANCISCO Comcast Corp may soon allow customers using its cloud-connected X1 cable box system to buy games from Electronic Arts Inc through their televisions  according to five sources briefed on the plans.

column4: Kraft says U.S. probing wheat trades by Mondelez-owned businesses
column5: May 2 Kraft Foods Group Inc said in a filing on Friday that U.S. regulators were probing wheat futures trading by businesses now owned and operated by Mondelez International Inc  which it spun off in 2012.

column4: Ex-MoneyGram compliance chief put on leave as U.S. fine looms
column5: ST. LOUIS A former compliance chief at MoneyGram International has been suspended from his current lobbying job for a credit-union trade group as he prepares to defend against a potential $5 million fine over his role in the money-transfer giant's anti-money laundering failures.

column4: Ex-MoneyGram compliance chief put on leave as U.S. fine looms
column5: ST. LOUIS  May 2 A former compliance chief at MoneyGram International has been suspended from his current lobbying job for a credit-union trade group as he prepares to defend against a potential $5 million fine over his role in the money-transfer giant's anti-money laundering failures.

column4: Pimco had $5.5 bln outflows from U.S. mutual funds in April -Morningstar
column5: NEW YORK  May 2 Bond giant Pimco posted $5.5 billion in outflows across its U.S. open-end mutual funds in April  data from Morningstar showed on Friday.

column4: News Corp ties knot with romance novel publisher
column5: TORONTO/NEW YORK For Harlequin Enterprises Ltd  the romance novel publisher that News Corp agreed to buy for $415 million  the title of one of its latest offerings  "My Fair Billionaire " could well refer to Rupert Murdoch.

column4: UPDATE 4-News Corp ties knot with romance novel publisher
column5: TORONTO/NEW YORK  May 2 For Harlequin Enterprises Ltd  the romance novel publisher that News Corp agreed to buy for $415 million  the title of one of its latest offerings  "My Fair Billionaire " could well refer to Rupert Murdoch.

column4: News Corp to buy Torstar's romance publisher Harlequin
column5: TORONTO  May 2 News Corp NWSA.O said on Friday it would buy romance novel publisher Harlequin Enterprises Ltd from Canadian newspaper company Torstar Corp TSb.TO for C$455 million ($415 million) in cash in a move to boost its non-English book publishing.

column4: Torstar to sell romance novel publisher Harlequin to News Corp
column5: May 2 Canadian newspaper publisher Torstar Corp  said it would sell romance novel business Harlequin Enterprises Ltd to News Corp for C$455 million ($415 million) in cash.

column4: Factbox on U.S. sprinter Tyson Gay
column5: Factbox on former 100 meters world champion Tyson Gay  who on Friday accepted a one-year suspension for a 2013 positive doping test and forfeited his results from 2012  including an Olympic relay silver medal.

column4: FACTBOX-Athletics-Factbox on U.S. sprinter Tyson Gay
column5: May 2 Factbox on former 100 meters world champion Tyson Gay  who on Friday accepted a one-year suspension for a 2013 positive doping test and forfeited his results from 2012  including an Olympic relay silver medal.

column4: UPDATE 1-Ares Management slashes IPO size as demand wanes
column5: May 1 Ares Management LP could raise only about half of what it had intended from its initial public offering as weak demand led the investment firm to cut the offering size and price units below its anticipated range.

column4: China's Sina fined for indecent content in web porn crackdown
column5: Chinese Internet firm Sina Corp said it was fined 5.1 million yuan ($815 038) by Beijing authorities for allowing "unhealthy and indecent content" on its online reading channel and on its main website.

column4: China's Sina fined for indecent content in web porn crackdown
column5: May 2 Chinese Internet firm Sina Corp  said it was fined 5.1 million yuan ($815 038) by Beijing authorities for allowing "unhealthy and indecent content" on its online reading channel and on its main website.

column4: Vertex says cystic fibrosis drugs shown to boost lung function
column5: Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc on Thursday said a combination of its cystic fibrosis drug Kalydeco and an experimental compound was shown to improve lung function in a mid-stage trial  sending its shares up nearly 8 percent.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Vertex says cystic fibrosis drugs shown to boost lung function
column5: (Clarifies in fourth paragraph that Kalydeco is not used for patients with the most common genetic mutation associated with cystic fibrosis)

column4: U.S. seeks another extension for Okada payments probe
column5: TOKYO U.S. prosecutors are seeking to put a civil lawsuit between Wynn Resorts Ltd  and Japanese billionaire Kazuo Okada on hold for another six months to continue a criminal investigation into Okada and his companies regarding payments in the Philippines  according to a motion filed to a Nevada court.

column4: U.S. seeks another extension for Okada payments probe
column5: TOKYO  May 2 U.S. prosecutors are seeking to put a civil lawsuit between Wynn Resorts Ltd and Japanese billionaire Kazuo Okada on hold for another six months to continue a criminal investigation into Okada and his companies regarding payments in the Philippines  according to a motion filed to a Nevada court.

column4: Intellectual Ventures settles lawsuit against investor Xilinx
column5: SAN JOSE  Calif.  May 2 Patent owner Intellectual Ventures has settled a lawsuit against one of its own investors  chipmaker Xilinx  a case that had been closely followed by advocates seeking to change the U.S. patent system.

column4: Exclusive: Abbott taps Morgan Stanley to sell mature products - sources
column5: NEW YORK Abbott Laboratories  is considering selling a big chunk of its mature drugs  joining a list of large drugmakers seeking to sell their older products in an effort to focus on high-growth areas  people familiar with the matter said.

column4: Pershing Square sits on hefty gains in Allergan bet
column5: BOSTON William Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management is already sitting on a $1.2 billion gain above his trading costs on his bet on Botox-maker Allergan Inc  according to a filing made on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Pershing Square sits on hefty gains in Allergan bet
column5: BOSTON  May 2 William Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management is already sitting on a $1.2 billion gain above his trading costs on his bet on Botox-maker Allergan Inc   according to a filing made on Friday.

column4: Pershing Square gets permission to turn Allergan options into shares
column5: BOSTON  May 2 Hedge fund manager William Ackman's $13.6 billion Pershing Square Capital Management has received permission from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission to turn Allergan Inc options into shares  a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.

column4: S&P puts Telekom Austria on credit watch positive
column5: VIENNA  May 2 Standard & Poor's put Telekom Austria on credit watch positive on Friday after America Movil said it would offer to buy Telekom Austria's outstanding shares and support a 1 billion-euro ($1.39 billion) capital increase.

column4: S&P puts Telekom Austria on credit watch positive

column5: LONDON U.S. drugmaker Pfizer Inc increased its offer for AstraZeneca Plc to 63 billion pounds ($106 billion) on Friday  but the British company promptly rejected the proposal  which would create the world's biggest pharmaceuticals company. | Video

column4: Robust earnings  U.S. jobs data push FTSE to 2-month high
column5: LONDON  May 2 Britain's top share index hit a two-month closing high on Friday as investors welcomed strong U.S. jobs growth  with RBS and InterContinental Hotels  the most notable risers on the back of robust earnings.

column4: Robust earnings  U.S. jobs data push FTSE to 2-month high
column5: LONDON  May 2 Britain's top share index hit a fresh two-month high on Friday  with RBS and InterContinental Hotels the most notable risers on the back of robust earnings  as investors also welcomed strong U.S. jobs growth.

column4: Verizon  AT&T say California probes their waste disposal
column5: NEW YORK California is investigating whether top mobile carriers Verizon Communications Inc and AT&T Inc illegally disposed of hazardous waste at their facilities in the state  the companies said in recent filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commision.

column4: Verizon  AT&T say California probes their waste disposal
column5: NEW YORK  May 2 California is investigating whether top mobile carriers Verizon Communications Inc  and AT&T Inc illegally disposed of hazardous waste at their facilities in the state  the companies said in recent filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commision.

column4: STOCKS NEWS EUROPE-Pace falls on concerns over AT&T and DirecTV deal report
column5: May 2    Shares in British set-top box maker Pace Plc  fall as much as 5.6 percent  making it the top percentage loser on Britain's mid-cap FTSE 250 index  after a report saying AT&T has approached DirecTV about a possible purchase of the satellite TV company.

column4: Taiwan stocks rise on upbeat Fed; AU Optronics jumps on earnings
column5: TAIPEI  May 2 Taiwan stocks rose as much as 1 percent on Friday morning as investors cheered upbeat statements from the U.S. Federal Reserve and turned a hopeful eye on earnings and guidance from large industry players in the Taiwan tech scene.     The main TAIEX index rose 70.57 points to 8862.01 as of 0205 GMT  beating other regional bourses. It touched a high of 8875.90 earlier in the session.     The market had fallen 0.9 percent in the previous session and was closed on Thursday
